conversation.content: [relieved] The judge ruled in my favor. Full custody. I should be—I mean, I am happy, I fought so hard for this. [pause] But when I picked them up yesterday, the way Emma looked at me... [regretful] like I was the villain in her story. [sigh] Jake won't even speak to me, just these one-word answers. "Fine." "Whatever." "Sure." [bitter] They think I destroyed our family, that I'm the one who—[voice breaking] but they don't understand what was happening behind closed doors, you know? [defensive] I had to protect them. I had to. Even if it meant becoming the bad guy in their eyes. [crying while speaking] Emma said she hates me for making Dad look bad in court. She's twelve—she doesn't know about the drinking, the... [trailing off] [long pause] Maybe I should've handled it differently? But how? [frustrated] How do you explain to your kids that sometimes love isn't enough, that sometimes protecting them means they'll hate you for it? [very quietly] Jake used to run to me when he got home from school. Now he goes straight to his room. [sniffle] I won. [bitter laugh] I won everything and lost them anyway. [whispering] What kind of victory is that?
